benchmark_details.name: NL-E YE (Natural Language for Visual Abductive Reasoning)
benchmark_details.overview: NL-E YE is a benchmark designed to assess VLMsâ€™ visual abductive reasoning skills by adapting the abductive Natural Language Inference task to the visual domain. It evaluates the plausibility of hypothesis images based on a premise image and requires models to explain their decisions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the visual abductive reasoning capabilities of visual language models (VLMs) and identify their weaknesses in reasoning tasks.

data.source: Data curated from human-written descriptions and generated images using text-to-image models.
data.annotation: Manual curation by experts involving writing descriptions, generating images, and creating explanations.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated based on the proportion of correct predictions against total predictions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance in abductive reasoning tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Humans achieved 85% accuracy while VLMs performed significantly lower, often at random baseline levels.
methodology.validation: The benchmark was validated by comparing human performance against VLMs across multiple input types and settings.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The dataset includes AI-generated images; potential for sensitive content was recognized and mitigated as much as possible.
